item.title: Japanese-style visual novel Nagi no Koi coming to PS4, Switch in spring 2026 in Japan
item.content:encoded:
• PS4
  • Switch

A digital-only release published by Entergram.

Entergram will release Nutrients-developed Japanese-style visual novel Nagi no Koi digitally for PlayStation 4 and Switch in spring 2026 in Japan for 2,700 yen, the publisher announced.

Nagi no Koi first launched for PC on August 20, 2021 in Japan, followed by an English-localized Steam release on January 14, 2025.

While the Steam version only included voice-overs for the four female leads, the console versions will add voices to the male and minor female characters for a fully voiced experience. Actor auditions are available now via the game’s official website. The console versions will also have a revamped user interface.

It is currently unclear whether the console versions will include English text.

Here is an overview of the game, via its Steam page:

About

Nagi no Koi is a Japanese-style visual novel where two stories intersect.

Players read through the story and make choices at branching points to change it.

Key Features

  • Genre: Japanese visual novel where players made choices based on their feelings.
  • Play time: Six hours (if you listen to all of the voice lines).
  • Overview: The game is divided in two parts. (The first part is divided into two chapters, each of which consisting of three parts following a traditional Japanese narrative structure: introduction, climax, and closure. After completing the two chapters players can then choose the second part of the story.)
  • Voices: Only the main female characters are voiced.

Recommended For

  • People who like visual novel type games.
  • People who like emotionally intense stories.
    People who like pure love stories.

Synopsis

—Chapter of the Red Spider Lily

Masahide’s dream was to become the Lord that would rule this land.

But his dream, along with his ego, was crushed, leaving him without any pride.

It was then where a girl named Sahana scolded him for living his life as a mere cog of the government.

He enters into a loveless political marriage with Sahana, but that relationship slowly changes them both.

As it gradually transforms into a passionate relationship, Masahide decides to pursue a dream he once gave up on.

—Chapter of the Water Lily

A man without memories.

Completely lost, unable to remember even his name, is saved by a girl named Suirin.

For Suirin’s sake, he turns his existence around.

Across the sea, where the nagidori calls.

Kai’s memories lie dormant in the sea.

Cast

  • Suirin (voiced by Tanemaki)
  • Sahana (voiced by Yurara)
  • Shenhua (voiced by Sasorihime)
  • Aoi (voiced by Sakura)

Mature Content in This Game

This game contains depictions of violence, gore, references to sexual acts, and scenes involving alcohol consumption.

item.title: Maid of Sker VR announced for PS VR2, SteamVR, and Quest
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • PS VR2
  • PS5
  • Quest

Due out in November.

Wales Interactive has announced Maid of Sker VR, a virtual reality version of the previously released survival horror game Maid of Sker for PlayStation VR2, SteamVR, and Quest. It will launch in November.

Here is an overview of the game, via Wales Interactive:

About

Brave the nightmares of the Quiet Ones. Do not panic… don’t even breathe!

Maid of Sker VR is a first-person survival horror, set in a remote hotel with a gory and macabre history from Welsh folklore. Armed with only a defensive sound device, you’ll utilize stealth tactics to avoid death amongst a cult of sound-based AI enemies.

Set in 1898 and inspired by the haunting Welsh tale of Elisabeth Williams, this is a story of a family empire driven by torture, slavery, piracy and a supernatural mystery that suffocates the grounds of the hotel.

Key Features

  • 3D sound-based AI system as the core survival mechanic.
  • A chilling story inspired by Welsh folklore fusing psychological, gothic, and British horror.
  • Re-imagining of famous Welsh hymns Calon Lan (A Pure Heart), Suo-Gân (Welsh Lullaby), and Ar Hyd Y Nos (All Through the Night) from the spine-chilling voice of Tia Kalmaru.
